column1: dream_report
I had a dream that my dad was getting hunted down and I was terrified. I also remember vividly a nightmare when I was 8 that aliens abducted me and only gave me a sandwich to eat over 10 years
i dont like thinking about it it was weird and my grandpa died. i felt stressed out and confused

I had a dream where I was entered into an experiment without my knowledge.  In this experiment, every door in the world took you to an alternate universe.  It was extremely scary.  The first door took me to an Australian man's home, he kept many different exotic animals as pets, such as ostriches, giraffes, snakes, and crocodiles.  I went through a few more doors, ending up in crazy locations, before ending up in a lab, where I met up with my younger brother who also somehow got involved in the experiment.  We were also joined by another teenager who was unaware of the experiment, but tagged along with us anyways.  We later noticed strange behavior from him, before eventually concluding he was one of the evil scientists involved in the creation of the experiment.  We narrowly escaped him and then I woke up.

I was at a party with a bunch of friends and we were surrounded by a fence and there was a house party and then a giant explosion and barrels flew everyone and I jumped to save my friend and then everyone started getting electrocute and I unplugged a cord and everything stopped.

I had a dream that i saved a cat. It was hurt and frail, probably hungry as well. The biggest thing i remember was the cats fur being bald, bloody, and sad. I took the cat home and fed it and kept it.
I was on a skiing trip and was going down the alps. The snow was cold and fluffy and the air felt crisp.

This dream started out with me running away from someone. I never got a good look at the person so I dont know what he looked like, however I knew it was a guy from an organization. I dont know why they were after me, the only thing I knew was that I had information they wanted. So I ran from them. I somehow knew parkour to easily maneuver out of their traps and being cornered. I remember jumping on and over hard pointy fences, rolling in soft grass when I hit the ground, and how fast I was at moving compared to these agents who were trying to catch me. They were never armed because they wanted me alive to get the information so they never shot anything besides blow darts which I easily avoided. From how fast I moved and avoided things I could decipher that I was probably an agent of a different organization then the one hunting me. I hid in cities, homes, and vehicles to travel but they always found me and we were in a footed chase again. Either that or I was fighting someone but it was mostly me avoiding them. after the fourth time of avoiding these agents I woke up.

I was eating at a McDonalds with this really hot blonde chick and for some reason in the she kept on making eye contact with these two dudes at two bar type seats while we were in a booth right next to them. One of them was talking about the ice cream cone they got and the random blonde chick went up and asked if she could have a lick. The guy tells her yes that she can and so she took a lick of his ice cream cone. After like 3-4 licks of the dudes ice cream cone she said thank you and out of no where looks at him for like 3 seconds and proceeds to move her face closer and closer to his face to then eventually full on making out with him in the middle of McDonalds with me watching the hot blonde chick that was supposedly with me make out with this other dude. I being completely shocked proceeded to run out of the McDonalds to find myself in the middle of one of those giant bush mazes where the bushes go up like 20-30 feet. So not thinking straight I just run right into the random bush maze that had many different pathways to take not knowing that. I still being blown away by my hot blonde girl doing that to me did not even think to consider where I was headed. I ran into every dead end possible in that maze that I completely lost faith in getting out of the maze. After like 15 minutes, I saw a little bit of open space ahead of me. Thinking I finally came to the end of the maze I ran as fast as I could. Once I finally got there I could not believe what I saw. I saw the same McDonalds! This time though it seemed different. I went inside the McDonalds and I saw a random dude on the date with a hot blonde girl. Then I eventually saw one of my best friends sitting at a stool type seat next to them sitting in a booth with two ice cream cones. I started getting into a conversation with him about tubing at the lake and then the girl that was on a date with the guy stood up and looked towards me and asked for a lick of my ice cream cone. Then I woke up unfortunately.
My whole family were aliens and I was creeped out.

I had a bag of pizza and i guess i wanted to see what would happen if i put grasshopper in the bag for a certain period of time. So i had so so many grasshoppers in the ziploc bag with the pizza that it wouldnt close and i can remember feeling the crunch and how the bag felt. I remembering dropping the bag cause it was so full and them spilling out. Then i made someone else pick up the bag cause i was disgusted and scared, there were very few left and they zipped it up. Thats all i remember
I cant describe the dream in detail now.
I had a dream that my family gave my dog to my uncle (my dog past away a few months ago) and my uncle gave him tatoos. I remember feeling super sad.
It was weird. I live in the Ellsworth dorm and in my dream, I got stuck in the elevator and I remember feeling like scared or worried.
All my friends came to visit me at KU
I had a dream that my brother was on heavy drugs and I went to go help him and I was extremely scared.

I had a dream that me and my roommate had adopted a puppy and were hiding it in my dorm. We were in our cozy two person dorm but the dog was being too loud and had to go outside and I was scared people would find out. My point of view was that i had to protect the dog and keep it safe. I was scared of my RA and neighbors. We got the dog for free while volunteering at the dog shelter. It was a small pomeranian and it was very energetic. We were trying to train it to hide.
I was sitting down and had a puppy. The puppy was black and white, it had curly hair, and it was soft. I felt happy and I wanted to take the puppy home.

Went to Texas to visit my best friend and hung out with her and her friends at Baylor. Then we went to a Gracie Abrams concert, that was in a house made out of all wood. The house had no furniture, just empty with a balcony. Gracie Abrams snapped me before the concert and asked if I knew someone, and I said yes. At the concert she came to me and talked to me.

Me and my friends in this school that looked kind of like Hogwarts. We jumped into a lake through a hole in some ice and became dolphins. Then as we swam deeper and were able to become mermaids. I remember being cold and stressed and had a hard time breathing when I was underwater. Then when we came back to school Idina Menzel sang defying gravity to us.
I was going for a walk on campus and everything was as normal and then the sky turned dark red and after that I woke up.

Had a dream about my ACCT exam. I dreamed that I was in the exam room in budig, it was hot, smelled musty, and packed to the brim with people. Everyone was frantic and I was super nervous. I hadn't studied much, was sweating a lot and had high anxiety. Over the next hour, my dream showed me struggling to answer the questions, with me ending up guessing on most of the questions. Then the dream fast forwards to my lab, showing me that I had failed the exam. This dream made me feel very scared about the exam and highlighted my internal feelings.

I had a dream on the night of the election that Trump was elected. I was happy. Many others were happy too, so there was cheering in the background. In my dream Kamala was upset about her loss and starting to film a child who had been injured and laughed almost in a way that made her feel better about herself.
I got back with my boyfriend from 2 years ago and we were at this park and that was in my home town. It was the first time we had talked in like a year but everything was back to normal.

I had a dream one night where I was seeing the dream through my own eyes. I was in a house on the staircase with my ex boyfriend. I loved him very much and the breakup was pretty messy, so in the dream I was confused why he was smiling at me. I asked if loved me and he responded with "How could I not love you? You're the best thing that ever happened to me." When I heard that in the dream I started crying and hugged him. It felt like a relief because in the dream I knew he did not hate me.

My dream took place in a big old house that reminded me of my childhood home. In this dream many of my family members were there, including immediate and extended family, as well as relatives that have passed away. In my dream I was a few years younger, and I was able to see it all from my point of view. My parents had to decided to sell the family house and I seemed to be the only one who was sad about it. My first ever dog, that has also passed away, was there and you could tell it was her time to go as well. I was sitting in my room reminiscing and crying about leaving my childhood home, but no one else seemed to care. They were all ready to move on and move out, but I was still stuck in the past. The dream felt very real, and somewhat relatable to past real life situations.

My grandma was taken by bad guys to an island outside of the city. My mother, father, and I had to rescue her from draco malfoy. We had to take a helicopter we stole from the island to save my grandma.

me and my roommate sleep on high lofted beds. one night in my dream the room started filling up slowly with water and every window and door slammed shut and around 5 locks appeared on each door. In order to escape we had to answer a certain question to unlock each lock. The last lock's question was einsteins riddle and we somehow solved it and escaped the room. That's when I woke up.

I had a dream that I was in Florida during the hurricane, and my boyfriend and his dad came to pick me up and we drove 20+ hours back to Missouri. It was stressful and weird that it was my boyfriend not my own family. I don't remember the drive itself but I do remember how scared we all were and we all kept looking back and I don't remember why.

I had a dream that I drove to Disney World from Overland Park with my ex-boyfriend. I was the actor, not an observer the whole dream. In the dream, the RV smelled like cigarettes and looked like it was from the 1990s. He was driving while I was in the back playing Lady Gaga. He's yelling at me to change the music. He still has a tan from summer, but I am super pale, so I am excited to be in Florida. When we got there, we rode a rollercoaster and ate funnel cake with way too much powdered sugar. The song "Mad at Disney" from TikTok was playing and we kept fighting about what ride to go on next. I wasn't very upset because it was more play-fighting than anything.

I was at Aldi the morning their advent calendars came out i was the second person in line and got to go in early they hadn't opened yet no workers were there but the doors were open so I went in. It was cold and foggy outside almost dewy rainy. I went to the back of the store to where the advent calendars were i climbed on the shelves because I am very short to see the ones o top in the back to find the one i wanted which was the candle one. I couldn't find it and started to worry I was int he wrong spot and was going to be gone when I figured it out. Everyone around me was grabbing what they wanted making me more anxious. I was loud with all the voices and a worker came over and I asked her for help to find the one i wanted. She said they didn't get that one in that week. I was so upset I had been looking forward to getting it for a week or so.

I was an actor. I was in my place of working, which is a nursing home so it was like apartments. I had just seen my friends outside of the window and watched them walk into a frat house. I decided to leave my work and join them in the frat house. They then called the cops on me which led me to feeling super upset. the cops then followed me back to my work and a fight broke out between them and it was super scary. the friends ended up apologizing but i could not forgive them.

i was in the woods with my father and we were standing next to an old 70's beat up bronco that my grandpa has, all of a sudden i look up toward the roof of the car and there is a doe standing there and i felt immense dread. it felt as if everything blacked out for a moment then i opened my eyes again and the doe had turned into a buck and was now charging tword me angrily, i felt justified in my dread and anxiety but wasn't reacting in and anxious or scared manor, i was just trying to hold it back by the antlers. I then hear my dad say "just show it whose boss" (like whose dominant) and i was suddenly a foot taller and the buck was now the size of a medium sized dog and had flipped it to its side and it had submitted to me the was a dog would. i immediately felt better and lost my feelings of anxiety, then i woke up.

I was camping out for the KU basketball game in Allen Fieldhouse. 16 groups got crossed off in front of us during roll call. I was very excited because I knew that we would get into the game earlier and get better seats.

In a dream I had the other night, I was walking down a busy city with tall buildings. When I was walking, I realized that one of the buildings was falling over on top of me and I ran to that building. While I was running to that building, the weather outside turned dark, and it was raining. I started pushing the building back up and yelling at everyone to get out of the ways. Then I woke up, and I was actually pushing my bedroom wall. So I was sleepwalking. That's all that I can remember.

In my dream i was trained to be a hunter with my family, i went through a series of rooms where i stopped inside what looked like to be an old jail holding place. I found a bow and arrow sitting on one of the walls and then a voice out of no where instructed me to shoot any mice that i found running around. Then as i look behind me i see my dad pick up another bow and arrow and he shoots the arrow at one of the light bulbs then thats when the dream ended and i woke up.

I was in the city of Lawerence, but my grandparents house was here. It was a nightmare. There was a man in their house that came in while we were just relaxing and watching TV together, and he was mad at me for some personal reason and he had a gun. There was some random person who tackled him and I just remember running to hide and then I woke up. It was scary and really weird. It was from my own perspective the whole time. There was peace in the dream and then anxiety, stress, and fear.

In this dream I woke up in the Taekwondo school that I work at. I remember being confused as to why I was there. Then I remember going up to my boss and talking to him. I saw the mats, seating area, and the office where my boss was. After I talked to him I went to my car and drove home to hang out with my friends. Then after that in my dream I was in my room for some reason I took a pregnancy test and found out I was pregnant. Then after that I woke up and was really confused
I had a dream that there was a poisonus rattle snake in my hair and it bit me. I was in bed, and my head was curly, and it was nestled in it. I felt scared and terrified.

I was at my coworker's house named Carl. He is about 32 I think, and he had a brain injury when he was younger where he can only move one side of his body. He told me in real life that after going through a lot of physical therapy he can walk and talk but cant move his right arm and it is stuck as a "claw". He creeps me out at work because he is always yelling my name across the registers so that I talk to him and he used to always ask me how old I was and where I lived. In the dream I was visiting his house because he wanted to hang out and I ended up staying the night for some reason even though I was very uncomfortable with it. He tried pressuring me into sex and I couldn't figure out how to get away. I was panicking and telling him no while he was trying to take pictures of me. His family came over and so he had to leave the room and I walked downstairs pretending nothing happened because I didn't want to worry his parents. They thought it was weird that I was there and obviously knew that I stayed the night because I was wearing pajamas. I was a little cold because the house was big with tile floors. Because it was such a big house I didn't know where to go so that I could leave and I started feeling more and more nervous. Usually I realize I am in a dream and I wake myself up which is what I think I did that night. My POV in the dream was a mix of 3rd person and 1st person. Sometimes I would be in my position interacting with Carl or something and then I would be looking down watching myself walking around the house.

My dream took place at what my brain believed to be Naismith but was actually a hotel castle that I couldn't find the front doors to, as I was walking around there I transported to a tropical environment and felt as though I was on vacation. My friends were inside playing pool but when I was trying to find them I was pulled into a family tour where it felt like a Disney cruise commercial. As I walked into one of the hotel rooms with this family I was hit by a swirling of colors which were pink and purple mostly. The entrance to the hotel was cave light and there was a talking barbie doll greeting us. Then the lights went away and I was stuck with a smaller non-living barbie doll that felt ominous.

I was jumping from place to place and scenario to scenario, but they all made me feel stressed and anxious. By the way, I was lucid dreaming and knew that I was dreaming the entire time. Now back to the dream. I was at first "woken" from my sleep even though I was still dreaming and was running late to work and had overslept and missed my alarm. I get dressed as quickly as I could and felt like I almost teleported to work. While at work I kept feeling this uneasiness as if I was missing something. Work continued until it hit me that I had an assignment due from my chemistry class and for some reason had an exam. The setting then abruptly shifts and I am now in the exam room of gray little taking an exam over equilibrium constants, acids and bases, etc. As I'm looking at these questions, there's information missing as if they're almost a blurry film over them. I begin to panic as I don't understand what I'm looking at and can't answer the questions. There's then this nagging feeling that I need to wake up, for context I have work in morning at 7am and I feel like I'm oversleeping, so I all of sudden jolt awake and see that it's 4:30am and that I haven't overslept. I then fall back asleep and didn't have any vivid dream I could remember.

I was living in a school-based apartment, right next to the school, and next to the school was a mental hospital where people are known to jump out from. One day when walking through the halls of school, I looked out the window and saw a girl on top of the roof, sitting down and swinging her feet. She was looking at me, then got up and jumped. I ran straight downstairs to make sure she was already. When I got to the parking lot, I had to push through a lot of people to see what was happening; she was dead. I was close enough to see her body, and she was staring at me, then got up and ran to me, but I was the only person who could see it. The ambulance took her body away. She began to haunt me, follow me everywhere, and I couldn't figure out why.

I recently had a dream that I was forced to have sex in front of an audience, got pregnant with an unwanted baby, and then tried to terminate the pregnancy by inserting a wire coat hanger inside myself. I was terrified, it was so embarrassing and involved so much blood. I didn't feel the pain or sensation or having sex however.

I recently had a dream that my boyfriend had broken up with me. We had been hanging out just the two of us, I think we went shopping and had lunch then came back to my apartment. While we were there he was like "I think we should see other people/go our separate ways" and I remember being okay with it at first, but then I switched, and I was very upset and asking him why over and over. I remember begging almost, and he was just like packing his stuff up and leaving without giving me an explanation as to why he wanted to break up. I like chased him downstairs and all of our friends were there. His best friend was there specifically and was like "bro why are you doing this" to my boyfriend. And then the door to my apartment opened and it was like bright and sunny, and we were in like a Walmart parking lot. And then I woke up.

The dream started with my girlfriend and me in bed in a studio apartment we want to rent watching the musical Nerdy Prudes Must Die by Starkids on youtube. It felt really comforting to be around her as we have been long distance for a few months now. Then I think it was during The Woods part of NPMD that we were just suddenly in the musical. We ran from Max who was the reanimated dead bully from the show. It was weird though because after that we hid in the audience as the summoning scene went on. Then I was in my dorm alone watching the news and it said that the election was void and there was another one but we then again lost to trump. Then a bomb dropped on Kansas but like it was the size of the state of Kansas. 
I am sorry I don't really remember more specific details it is kind of a blur.

I was in my high school cafeteria for a small portion of the dream, but I could sort of fly by jumping around and getting almost "stuck" in the air. It was more like a suspended jump, but my direction and movement speed was very limited. I went upstairs into one of the classrooms and got into a small argument with a teacher I am not fond of, and my sister appeared into the room. My sister passed away several years ago, and once I saw her I was snapped out of the fiction of the dream and focused on her presence. She seemed to ignore that I was reacting to her presence strangely, and instead followed the plot of the dream like normal.

there was this goat but its leg was bent and then the villain in my dream (who was a character from 13 reasons why) killed the goat with garlic and then i was in a lecture that was taken over by a new professor because the old one was the guy who killed the goat. and my best friends brother jumped off of a building and my best friend came to visit me but i was on a bus with other girls from her high school softball team.

I had a dream where I was entering a library to study for my classes. I walked into a room, thinking that it was welcome to everyone. Once I sat down, I felt like I was not supposed to be there. This made me feel anxious and nervous. I felt people staring at me and was paranoid that they were judging me for being there. There was a person in charge assigning everyone directions and coaching everyone. Everyone kept working. I sat there frozen because I felt paralyzed from my anxiety. I tried to go along with it and act like I was typing on my computer like everyone else. I was still confused at this point, but once everyone started to walk out of the room I left with the crowd and realized what happened. I walked into a room where there was a "study group" and everyone who was in the room was receiving extra credit for a class. Then the group walked outside into a lobby. A woman was handing out snacks and offered me one first. I accepted it and thanked her, but was still confused. It was gelatin based food that she said had several health benefits. She gave me two servings. After I finished it, I noticed that no one else ate it. Then, another person in charge of the group asked if there was enough  for everyone. I overheard her say this and was more confused. Someone answered her and said yes, but just one for everyone. People kept staring at me and one person who I recognized laughed at me. Then I woke up.

It’s a story about me accompanying a girl who looks like Roxy Migurdia. It revolves around the entire world that is slowly being heated up, melting all icy parts of the world. This is a problem because Roxy is a part of a clan that can only survive in the cold. So the whole journey is getting her to colder and colder areas with an RV as they all gradually melt behind us. We also have enhanced physical strength, speed and jumping capability to jump from ice cap to ice cap. At some point we reach the final ice cap and we know it’s melting slowly but I act as if everything is fine but Roxy knows it’s not, so she steps out of her RV onto the thinning ice and let’s it melt, falling into the ocean to eventually drown but telling me to go back to land and that it’s unfortunate how life was like this. After this I had a memory of bringing Roxy to regular land at some point using an Ice suit when we were children. I would spend fun time with her over years with this method but as I matured, I would notice her getting bullied ruthlessly for her race; I would watch and not do anything and sometimes egg it on. I feel intense guilt washing over me as Roxy dies and I wake up.

I was a photographer for a recital at my former dance studio. I remember feeling stressed and trying to do my best and get all the right angles. I was sort of running around backstage and then I saw my ex-boyfriend's little sister whom I was very close to. I knew I would see her mom eventually, so I got very anxious and scared to see her. After that I turned the corner and saw her mom and she hugged me. I was disappointed in her because of how her son treated me and sort of resented her. I also felt awkward because I don't like hugs it didn't really matter that it was from her.

I was walking through a dense forest in the middle of the night, with fog hanging low over the ground, so thick I could barely see my feet. The air was cold and damp, and every now and then, I’d feel a faint breeze against my face. There was this eerie silence, broken only by the crunch of leaves underfoot. I remember feeling both lost and strangely calm, like I knew I had somewhere to be but wasn’t in a hurry.

I went back home for break and in the dream and i felt like I was awake but i couldn't move my body. I watched as all of my lifes important events played out. And then i started to be transformed into different places all with the soul purpose of waking up. After I got out of one place, I would go into another. This took a while to wake up. The dreams consisted of getting into a fight with my parents, having to slay dragons, relive moments with people I'm not friends with anymore. I then started to wake up in different parts on my house, but couldn't actually wake up till I was in the exact place I was in. Then i heard my dads voice, he was asking me to go to a restaurant with him. I anxiously hopped to every place I could think of. I finally arrived to the place I feel asleep in. I imagined that I ran to the car and got in last minute. Finally in the car, my dad turns to me and says "you are still dreaming" and then I actually woke up.

I saw the KU campus and many people that I am close with, I felt a personal connection to each person that I recognized. It was almost as if I was an observer that was watching my interaction with my friends. The only thing notably different about the campus was that it was night outside and the stars were super bright.

I had a dream that my boyfriend broke up with me. It was weird because he’s one of the sweetest people I know. He became rude and then ended it but he still wanted to hangout. I felt very hurt and it felt real. when I woke up I was so relieved. During the dream I was devastated but somewhat soon before it ended I realized I was dreaming but I was still asleep. Even though I knew it was a dream a bit before, It was still nice to wake up to confirm it wasn’t real. it made me feel anxious and heartbroken. I think I had this dream because I took melatonin, I tend to have nightmares every time I take it.
I had a dream that I owned a taco shop

I was on my couch in my living room with a woman whom i had just met in real life. I was very attracted to her and we were having a great night. When we began to kiss, something changed and my roommates, who were not home in the beginning all arrived with several friends and interrupted my time with this girl. When we went into my room to avoid the commotion, there was a large amount of marijuana in the room that we began to smoke until the smoke filled the room and caused an issue. We heard sirens and a knock at the door and police came in the room and arrested everyone except me and the girl escaped onto the ledge of the window. My heart was racing and I felt adrenaline like nothing before. We managed to find a car and break into it and drove away with the police chasing us. I then realized that no matter what I did my life was over and I felt this overwhelming sense of dread and depression. I now had nothing but this girl whom I resented for ruining my life and tried to crash the car or drive off the road, but it just bounced off the walls and we could not stop driving. I was depressed and wanted it to be over and could not stop the feeling of fear and anxiety.

I find myself standing on the edge of a vast, tranquil lake. The surface of the water is perfectly still, reflecting the sky above like a mirror. The air is warm, and the scent of flowers and fresh grass fills my lungs with every breath. The sun is low on the horizon, casting a soft, golden glow over everything, turning the water into liquid light. I feel a deep sense of peace here, like time itself has slowed down.

I take a step forward, my feet sinking slightly into the soft earth beneath me. The sound of the water lapping gently at the shore fills the air, and I feel drawn to it, almost as if the lake is calling me. Without thinking, I slip off my shoes and step into the water. It's cool and refreshing, the sensation sending a shiver up my spine as I wade deeper, the water rippling around my legs.

As I walk further, I notice something unusual—a large, smooth stone rising out of the lake, like a natural platform. It’s perfectly round, covered in moss and small flowers. Intrigued, I make my way toward it, the water barely reaching my knees now. The stone feels warm under my feet as I step onto it, and I sit down, gazing out across the lake. The stillness is comforting, the world around me soft and full of possibility.

Suddenly, a soft light appears on the horizon, growing brighter as it comes closer. It’s not like the sun, but something else—shimmering and ethereal, like a star falling from the sky. It hovers just above the water, casting gentle beams of light across the surface. I watch in awe, feeling no fear, only wonder. The light moves toward me, and as it does, the water beneath it begins to glow in response.

Then, something shifts—slowly, almost imperceptibly—and I realize I’m no longer alone. A figure materializes from the light, their shape ethereal, but undeniably present. They are tall, dressed in flowing robes of soft white and gold, their face glowing but unformed, as if it’s not quite meant to be seen. But I can feel their presence deeply, like they’ve always been a part of me.

The figure steps closer, and as they do, a sense of understanding washes over me. It’s not through words, but through a knowing. They reach out, their hand hovering just in front of mine. I hesitate for only a moment before I take it. The moment my fingers brush theirs, I feel a surge of warmth—a warmth that spreads through me, filling me with peace and clarity. The figure’s presence is grounding, yet freeing, and I realize that they are both guiding me and reminding me of something I’ve always known.

Without speaking, they gesture toward the glowing water, and I look down. The surface is now a canvas, a swirling tapestry of colors and patterns—images of moments from my past, my present, and even glimpses of what might be. The water shows me the path I’ve walked, and the path that lies ahead, shifting and changing with every glance.

The figure nods once, as if to say, "You’re on the right path. Trust what you see, trust what you feel." Then, as quietly as they came, the figure begins to fade back into the light, leaving me with the lake, the warmth, and a newfound sense of direction.

I stay on the stone, my fingers still tingling from the touch, and watch as the light dissolves into the sky. The lake, now calm and clear again, reflects the stars as night falls. I feel a deep sense of peace, as if I’ve just been given a gift I didn’t know I needed. I stand slowly, taking one last look at the serene water before I turn and walk back along the shore, feeling lighter, like something inside me has shifted into place.

Im standing at the edge of a jungle. There is an opening to a path, I follow it to find a wide open area with lots of stars. There is also a bridge that looks sketchy and I cross it to end up falling into a trap, I have to navigate through a maze to escape the trap. At the end, I find a treasure chest of gold.
